chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat

Goal:
n <> 0 -> ⟬ 2 * n ⟭ = ⟘ :: ⟬ n ⟭

Premises:
nat_lb_spec : forall n : nat, g_nlb n ⟬ n ⟭
nat_lb_fix_0 = g_nlb_fun (nat_lb_spec 0) in_gnlb_0 : ⟬ 0 ⟭ = nil
arem = fun n d q j : nat => j <= d /\ (n = 2 * q * d + j \/ q <> 0 /\ n = 2 * q * d - j) : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments arem (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l)
g_nlb_ind : forall P : nat -> lb -> Prop, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
g_nlb_sind : forall P : nat -> lb -> SProp, P 0 nil -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟘ :: l)) -> (forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> P (div n 2) l -> P n (⟙ :: l)) -> forall (n : nat) (l : lb), g_nlb n l -> P n l
Inductive g_nlb : nat -> lb -> Prop := in_gnlb_0 : g_nlb 0 nil | in_gnlb_1 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 0 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟘ :: l) | in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l) Arguments g_nlb _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_1 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope Arguments in_gnlb_2 [n]%nat_scope [l]%list_scope
in_gnlb_2 : forall (n : nat) (l : lb), n <> 0 -> rem n 2 = 1 -> g_nlb (div n 2) l -> g_nlb n (⟙ :: l)
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
Nat.Even = fun n : nat => exists m : nat, n = 2 * m : nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.Even _%nat_scope
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
rem_2_fix_1 : forall n : nat, rem (2 * n) 2 = 0
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.neq_0_lt_0 : forall n : nat, n <> 0 < -> 0 < n
log2 = fun n : nat => log2_iter (pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments log2 _%nat_scope
lb_nat_fix_1 : forall l : lb, ⟦ ⟘ :: l ⟧ = 2 * ⟦ l ⟧
list_an = fix list_an (a n : nat) {struct n} : list nat := match n with | 0 => nil | S n0 => a :: list_an (S a) n0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments list_an (_ _)%nat_scope
sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments sub (_ _)%nat_scope
lb_nat = fix lb_nat (l : lb) : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => bool2nat x + 2 * lb_nat l0 end : lb -> nat Arguments lb_nat _%list_scope
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
BinNatDef.N.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.N0 | S n' => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n') end : nat -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.of_nat _%nat_scope
even = fix even (n : nat) : bool := match n with | 0 => ⟙ | 1 => ⟘ | S (S n') => even n' end : nat -> bool Arguments even _%nat_scope
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments lt (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.log2_up_same : forall a b : nat, 0 < a -> 0 < b -> Nat.log2_up a = Nat.log2_up b -> a < 2 * b
Nat.log2_same : forall a b : nat, 0 < a -> 0 < b -> Nat.log2 a = Nat.log2 b -> a < 2 * b
Nat.mul_assoc : forall n m p : nat, n * (m * p) = n * m * p
Nat.mul_add_distr_l : forall n m p : nat, n * (m + p) = n * m + n * p
Nat.mul_comm : forall n m : nat, n * m = m * n
div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat * bool := match n with | 0 => (0, ⟘) | 1 => (0, ⟙) | S (S n1) => let (p, b) := div2 n1 in (S p, b) end : nat -> nat * bool Arguments div2 _%nat_scope
